result.execSummary:
The defendant Scottie L W Kobs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $1,694.00 fine/cost to be paid to Probation while on Probation.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

No alcohol. Cannot vote until civil rights are restored. Cannot hold elected office. Other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
Must follow through with COMPAS Evaluation.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license. However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued. (Call Department of Motor Vehicles with questions).
Must complete an AODA assessment and compliance.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scottie L W Kobs

CASES: 15CF1, 14CF485, 14CF321, 14CF401, 15CF150, 11CF1, 10CF148 & 11CF20. Defendant Scottie Luke W Kobs in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Defendant Scottie Luke W Kobs in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 1:38 pm.  
Court Exh A-O&R.  States argument 1:58 pm.  Defense argument 2:26 pm. 2:36 pm-recess.  2:56 pm - back on the record.
No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
CT finds elig for CIP & Substance abuse pgm.

10CF148-CT 3- WSP-3 yr 6 mo, 1 yr 6 mo IC, 2 yr ES consec to 14CF321 count 1 & 14CF485 count 1.  Not order SO registry. CT finds elig for CIP & Substance abuse pgm.  Follow thru w/ COMPAS & requirements of ES.  Order DNA sample, $290.60 fine/costs.  DNA surcharge is waived.  Credit for 373 days credit

14CF321-Ct 1- WSP-3 yr 6 mo, 1 yr 6 mo IC, 2 yr ES consec to 10CF148 count 3 & 14CF485 count 1. CT finds elig for CIP & Substance abuse pgm.  $1694 fine/costs.  2 yr revocation, AODA & comply.  2 yr IID plus pd of incarceration, after valid license.  No alcohol & follow thru w/ requirements of COMPAS.  

14CF485- Ct 1- WSP-5 YR, 2 YR IC, 3 yr ES, consec to 10CF148 count 3 & 14CF321 count.  CT finds elig for CIP & Substance abuse pgm. $1694 fine/costs.  2 yr revocation, AODA & comply.  No alcohol, follow thru w/ COMPAS.  2 yr IID plus pd of incarceration.

ON 11CF1-Count 2, 11CF20 Count 1, 14CF401-Count 1 & 15CF150-Count 1- On ea - w/h probation up to 3 yr, Probation is consecutive to sentences in 14CF485, 10CF148 & 14CF321.  No alcohol, no drugs, follow COMPAS & recommendations of probation.  No contact w/ victims.

15CF150-Order DNA sample & $250 surcharge.
State requests 60 days to look into SO registry requirement.  
PCR.  3:50 pm adj.

Voucher to DOA for Polk Co treas to pay $640.61. Total statement $715.61 less $75.00 COC check from Atty Trust funds. Def assessed $640.61 for repayment of Atty Fees - added to PP - sent copy of statement/PP to def.
15C 027936 partial pymt of atty fees from trust funds.
14CF401-Information filed.  Kemp-NG plea.  14CF485-Information filed.  Kemp-NG Plea.
#1 - Ltr from DA Steffen to Atty Kemp re global resolution offer
